body_html: Thanks, what is the syntax for this? Do I set env variables in the script or add it to the line python setup.py install Or manually edit some cmake file? It seems that cmake found my mpi configuration on my machine and used it without asking me; if your build system engages with it by default but cannot support it I suppose this is a small bug. Cross platform mpi would be a great extension though. Terry On 24 Sep 2018, at 04:45, peterjc123 <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote: @terrylyons<https://github.com/terrylyons> Sorry, you cannot build PyTorch with MPI currently. Please turn that off by setting USE_DISTRIBUTED or USE_MPI to OFF and try again. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#12001 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGFm-_SzIOXnc3O4HZRBOT088kT6xsanks5ueFVmgaJpZM4W16iU>.
body_text:
Thanks, what is the syntax for this? Do I set env variables in the script or add it to the line
python setup.py install
Or manually edit some cmake file?

It seems that cmake found my mpi configuration on my machine and used it without asking me; if your build system engages with it by default but cannot support it I suppose this is a small bug.

Cross platform mpi would be a great extension though.

Terry

On 24 Sep 2018, at 04:45, peterjc123 <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:


@terrylyons<https://github.com/terrylyons> Sorry, you cannot build PyTorch with MPI currently. Please turn that off by setting USE_DISTRIBUTED or USE_MPI to OFF and try again.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#12001 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGFm-_SzIOXnc3O4HZRBOT088kT6xsanks5ueFVmgaJpZM4W16iU>.
body:
Thanks, what is the syntax for this? Do I set env variables in the script or add it to the line
python setup.py install
Or manually edit some cmake file?

It seems that cmake found my mpi configuration on my machine and used it without asking me; if your build system engages with it by default but cannot support it I suppose this is a small bug.

Cross platform mpi would be a great extension though.

Terry

On 24 Sep 2018, at 04:45, peterjc123 <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:


@terrylyons<https://github.com/terrylyons> Sorry, you cannot build PyTorch with MPI currently. Please turn that off by setting USE_DISTRIBUTED or USE_MPI to OFF and try again.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/12001#issuecomment-423871555>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGFm-_SzIOXnc3O4HZRBOT088kT6xsanks5ueFVmgaJpZM4W16iU>.
